Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by its completion, its purpose is fulfilled, and through its expositions and declarations, it seems to me that I complete it for you with this treatise, which is a part of operative medicine, that is, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For operative medicine is now, in our region and our time, completely hidden, so that the knowledge of it is greatly endangered, and its practice is restricted; and only some small descriptions remain in the books of the ancients, which have led to errors and hesitations, so that its understanding is clouded and its strength and art are lost.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will revive that [operative medicine] through the arrangement of this treatise, in accordance with a method of exposition, explanation, and abbreviation; and so that it will be understood through the forms of cautery tools and other instruments of the craft, with the addition of explanation and preparation for it, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a skilled craftsman with his own hands is not found in our time is that the art of medicine is extensive, and that its practitioner must first be practiced in the science of anatomy, which includes knowledge of the body parts and their forms, and the connection and separation of them; and must have knowledge of bones, nerves, ligaments, and their arrangement; and of the pulsating and still veins, and the places of their exit.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore Hippocrates says that a name is a word, but little in practice, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not familiar with what we have said about anatomy, will inevitably fall into errors that will cause the death of men, as I have seen too many of them, for some are trained in this science and abandon it without knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and inexperienced physician cut into a scrofulous abscess on a woman's neck, and cut some of the neck's arteries, so that a great deal of blood flowed until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician who attempted to remove a stone from a man who had suffered from it for many years.  The stone was large, and he managed to extract it, along with a piece of the bladder, which caused the man to die on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I, having been called to treat that case, saw that because of the size of the stone and the patient's condition, I knew he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician who received a stipend from a duke in our land for surgery, and was called to a black knight who had a fractured thigh.  The physician, through his ignorance, treated the fracture by pulling it together with bandages and splints with excessive tightness, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he loosened it according to his desires, and then he reapplied it, and then he left it for a few days and ordered that they loosen the bandage.  And this continued until the thigh and foot became ulcerated and festering, and thus led to the man's demise.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I arranged to loosen the bandage, and this brought about tranquility and a lessening of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But meanwhile, decay had already set in within the limb, so that I could not halt it, and the corruption continued within the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who opened a cancerous abscess, and it festered for several days, until the severity of the disease was magnified with the patient's suffering.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Because cancerous growths are primarily caused by melancholic humors, it is not appropriate to remove them with total destruction, but rather to focus on the affected limb to the extent that such treatment is tolerable.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the surgical procedure be divided into two parts: one part being the operation associated with healing, and the other part the procedure that carries significant risk in the most critical situations.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already indicated this throughout this book, in the surgical procedures where there is error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to observe this and abandon that, so the errors do not find a way to speak and disgrace you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take your tools with diligence and God's protection, and treat your patients with skill and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best methods, by God's grace, seeking health and praiseworthy success, and abandon those terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and remove from your tools anything that causes you fear, so that your reputation and your name may not be tarnished: for more remains for your glory, and higher in the world and behind your holiness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Guaila already said in some of his teachings/instructions:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a serious illness, lest you be called bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter, ordered from head to foot, deals with the types of instruments and cauteries, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on cutting and piercing, cupping, poultices, and the extraction of arrows and similar things, all categorized and ordered by the types of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and the treatment of twisting and similar injuries; a chapter ordered from head to foot, and concerning the types of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization with fire and with sharp medicine and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary for me to state the benefits of this cautery and its harms, and in which temperament cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the nature of the benefits and harms of cautery is long, extensive, scientifically subtle, and secretly hidden; and many wise men have already spoken of it, and they have disagreed about it, but a brief summary of their teachings will suffice to me, fearing to prolong the discussion.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery is beneficial to all temperaments universally, whether with or without matter, except for two temperaments, which are hot temperaments without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In a hot and dry temperament with matter, there is disagreement; for some have said that cautery is beneficial in that case, and others have said the opposite, that cautery is not suitable for an illness that is characterized by heat and dryness, for the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is inappropriate for a hot and dry illness to be treated with something that is also hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite argue that cautery provides benefit in all hot and dry illnesses that affect the human body, because when you compare the human body and its humours to the temperament of fire, you find the human body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, based on my own experience, that this has been revealed to me several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate for someone to offer an opinion on this who has not previously practiced and been educated in the chapter on cautery, and who does not understand the diverse temperaments of people, the nature of illnesses themselves, their causes, their symptoms, and the duration of these illnesses.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other temperaments, there is no cause for concern, especially in cold and moist illnesses, for all doctors agree on their treatment and are not divided on using cautery in these cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And understand, children, that the secret of curing with cautery using fire, and its beneficial effects, lies in the fact that fire is simple, its action only affects the part that is cauterized, and does not harm any other attached member except with little damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of a burning medicine spreads to the parts of the body distant from it, and readily causes difficult-to-heal illness and considerable harm in the diseased part.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, due to its intensity and beneficial nature, does not do this except excessively. And this is already known to us through experience and a long study of the art, concerning the truth of causes.  Therefore, I am excused from a lengthy discourse.  If it were not that it is not written in my book in this part, the secrets concerning the use of fire, and the way it operates in the body and how it expels illnesses, would be demonstrated in a philosophical discourse, which would be more valuable to you.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And understand, children, that they disagree on the time when cautery is best performed, and they suggest the best time is spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is suitable at any time, because the harm from the accidental effects of time is outweighed by the benefit brought about by the cautery, especially if the cautery is needed for sharp, sudden pains, which cannot tolerate delay because the feared harm from the worsening condition is greater than any minor harm from the passage of time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not something you should take seriously, children.  The common people and foolish physicians believe that a disease cured by cautery is not always cured completely, and they believe that this is the consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not as they suppose.  Cautery is only a type of medicine that alters the constitution and dries up the moisture that causes the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nonetheless, cautery is superior to other medicines because of its potency, the effectiveness of its operation, and the great benefit of its use.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness may return at some point in time, depending on the patient's constitution, the location of the illness, the patient's strength, and the accumulation of excess fluids in the body, and what they have eaten and things similar to that; however, if the illness for which cautery is administered is a minor illness in a part of the body with few excess fluids and moisture, similar to toothache and similar cases, it is possible that the pain will not return, but this will take a little time.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common saying is that cautery is the last resort in medicine, and this is a true statement, not in the way they understand it, because they believe that there is no cure that is as beneficial as cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the truth is the opposite.  The idea that cautery is the last resort in medicine is only true when we've tried other methods of treatment for certain illnesses, and those other methods aren't effective; then, and only then, cautery is used as a final, effective treatment.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Therefore, the statement that cautery is the last resort in medicine is not true, according to the understanding of the common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they didn't say this without reason; it's because of the equal and superior nature of gold's substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the cautery location doesn't make a difference, but that's not entirely true.  I've proven it; I've found that this only applies in some bodies, not all.  Cautery with gold is better than with iron, as they say; however, when you use gold cautery, it's not at all clear to you how much heat you are applying due to the gold's resistance to heat. It makes the area ready to receive the heat; if you increase the heat, the gold melts into the fire and some pieces of gold fall into the fire, and the craftsman is therefore harmed by this.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, cautery with iron is done more easily and more appropriately for the success of the procedure.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cautery according to topics, and I have organized those from head to feet, so that the reader can find what they need.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for head pain caused by cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization addresses dampness and coldness affecting the brain, the causes of which are twofold: one is the cause of excessive and numerous rheumatic fluxes, called "coriza," flowing from the head to the eye and ear areas; the other is excessive sleepiness, and toothaches, and throat pain, and generally all ailments arising from cold, including paralysis, stroke, and similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows: first, instruct the patient to be cleansed with laxative medicine, cleansing the head, for three or four nights, according to the patient's strength, age, and usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then order him to shave his head, and afterwards, place him seated between your hands on a smooth bench, and let him place his hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then, place the tip of your palm near the bridge of his nose, between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when the tip of your middle finger has reached the spot, mark that spot with a stylus, and then apply the olive-oil cautery, of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then place that [cautery] on the spot marked with the stylus, in such a way that it descends, with which your hand is gradually tightened, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then lift your hand slightly and observe the spot, and if you see any significant amount of bone exposed, as much as a grain of corn, then raise your hand; and if not, return your hand with that iron, with another from that set, if it has cooled, until the bone is visible as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a little salt and dissolve it on the spot and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place some cloth soaked in broth/broth-like liquid over it and leave it until the scab from the fire has been destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with tetrafarmacon ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And if they say that while the wound remains open, the arm should be lifted higher, for it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's substance is adhered to it.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then scrape off whatever is adhering to the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery they should get to the back of it, pressing forcefully onto the bone until it bursts, and this is the method of a small cautery.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place, the vapors from the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be kept open for a long time, and then treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, I have not seen these two types of cautery in everyone, but only in some cases, out of fear; and in my view, it is better to use healing methods when they are; for the head is weakened by a breach in its continuity, just as we have seen in other parts of the body, especially when the patient's head is of a weak constitution.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and with that method and practice, there is healing.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Concerning cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain affects the entire head, in a prolonged illness, and remedies such as leeches, cupping, head purges, plasters, poultices, herbs, poultices, and similar treatments have been used, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery that has provided no benefit, then consider that if the patient's head is strong in its constitution and not weak, and finds itself with a very severe cold, then cauterize with another cautery slightly below the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize the area above the patient's temples with the cautery until the pain is relieved.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut open the affected area, and if bone is visible, cauterize that area with a cautery at the back of the head, in the place called the *vas* (or vessel) – which is where the cupping is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And be careful in doing this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will experience very severe pain different from the pain of other cauterizations on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I would say this cautery is in its proper place, for the cautery used for cauterizing the temples and the back of the head should be a finer cautery than the one used for cauterizing the middle of the head; and this is the method to follow.
Capitol ters.	Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Concerning the cauterization of non-chronic headaches.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a persistent or spreading pain occurs in the head, or extends to the eyes, the head should be cleansed with medicaments, and the other treatments mentioned in my descriptions of illnesses should be administered; and if nothing works, then cauterization in that area can be done in two ways: either with a burning medicinal cautery, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But the cautery with a burning medicinal substance is that you take a clove of garlic, peel and trim its ends from both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then, you pierce the painful spot in the temple with a sharp lancet until a small cavity is created under the scalp, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then, press on it with a bandage to compress it firmly, and leave it for three hours; and then remove it and take away the garlic, and let the wound rest for two or three days, and then place a cloth soaked in vinegar there until the area heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines, which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterization with iron, following this method:  heating by cautery, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "clavus clavilus," because the head of it is shaped like a nail, in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small eminence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place it on the painful area, and hold your hand—so that the surrounding tissue is not burned—and rotate the small iron bit by bit with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of tissue that is being burned, through the nature of the cautery, is, as it were, half of it, then lift your hand to avoid burning the underlying artery, so that blood does not flow.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak cotton in salt water and place it on the area, and leave it for three days; then place cotton moistened with butter, and then treat with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the edge of the knife, according to the cautery method, and be careful not to cut an artery in this particular, not-old, migraine.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of old migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migraine using the methods previously discussed, and the treatments outlined in the sections on illnesses, and the cure proves ineffective, and sometimes because the disease is too far gone, when the previous cauterizations with medicine or with fire fail, then you must heat the knife cautery until it is white-hot. Then apply it to the painful area, following a line whose length is half a finger, or a bit longer.  Then, apply your hand once and press firmly until you penetrate the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful not to damage the continuation of the jaw, which is strained by mastication, and that the tendon and nerves that move it are not injured and cause spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the control and caution of the flow of blood from the cut artery, for in the cutting of it there is fear, especially for those who are ignorant of what they are doing and are not skilled or practiced; and they leave the operation unfinished at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the treatment of accidental blood flow from the artery, according to its method, in its proper place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this treatment is not sufficient for this illness, and you find the patient's condition tolerable, cauterize the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, apply the cautery mentioned in the chapter on arterial constriction with a two-bladed cautery; this is a better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of ear aches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear comes from cold and is treated with laxatives and other treatments as described in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then apply the cautery, which is called a 'puncta,' and this is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then apply the cautery's point, and let the burning move around the entire ear in a circular motion, or along the affected area if the pain is localized.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move the cautery from the base of the ear slowly, after marking the spot with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery is used to apply ten points to the whole ear, and cauterizes them, then treat the spots until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cauterization of tumors.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tumors that are cured with cauterization are only of the types that come from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type that arises from dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of tumor with leeches, purges, and remedies, and your treatment does not work, then you must cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one at the base of the ear, a second a little below the temple, and a third at the juncture of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery opposite the diseased part, for softening only comes to the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is to cauterize with the cautery at the right end of the ear, then slightly above the horn of the head; another one at the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the index finger; and keep your hand with the cautery until the quantity of half the thickness of the tumor is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the method of cauterization, and it is a type of surgical procedure, the method of which is described below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle than that which you see; and it is necessary to cut away some of the superfluous thickness there.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what has been previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cauterization for old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old, and you have treated it with what we have said, and your treatment isn't helping the patient, and the patient has no fever, then cauterize with four cauteries: on each corner of the head; and with cauteries on the middle part of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery on the jaw.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done according to what has been stated above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is further back; and then it should be treated with what you proceed with.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization for forgetfulness caused by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	There should be given to the patient at the beginning large jars and pills that cleanse the brain.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the patient's entire head and place on their forehead a poultice of the type described in the treatise on poultices.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply that several times, for that is a method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the same order that I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so, if that cures him, well and good; and if not, then make three cauteries on the back part of his head, which descend from the most superior part of the head down to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the thickness of a finger between each cautery, and then treat the cautery with what was previously mentioned.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you [judge] the patient is capable of tolerating it, then make the cautery in the middle place; and if you deem [it needs] more application, then cauterize that area over the two [lateral] horns/bumps.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat that until it is healed; and let the cautery be oiled according to the previously described method.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization for paralysis and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You should proceed with cleansing the head with herbs and as we have said; then shave the patient's head, then cauterize the middle of the head with cautery, and with cautery on all the bumps/horns of the head, and with cautery on the back part of the head, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if the illness of softening of the body is severe and the patient is enduring it, and the illness is strong, then cauterize it with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and continuously with cautery until the spine is noticeably relaxed, and lift your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat it until it is healed, and this should be olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Concerning the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat the brain of the patient at the beginning of the illness, using herbs and other treatments as we have described in the division when the illness is severe and can tolerate the application of medicine.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate medicine, then administer gargles and masticatories to treat the brain, before this for many days, with proper nourishment and diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then, shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, in the manner previously described, and with another cautery on the back of the head, and cauterize on each side of the head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the illness is severe and can tolerate it, then cauterize it with the cauteries mentioned, having previously performed paralysis and softening of the body, over the spine of the neck and the spine of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Let the cautery be olive-shaped, as was previously mentioned.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then place a delicate cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and thick phlegm, then cauterize that with the cauteries which we have mentioned in the previous chapter on paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is a superfluity descending into melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give him to drink what purifies his brain according to what has been previously stated in the division [of remedies].
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient's head, and then carefully apply a properly made plaster to the scalp, and then place it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be seated upright, and be held securely in all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply liniment; and an old sheep's fleece is even more suitable.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over a moderate fire, to the degree that the patient can tolerate it being placed on them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then apply that to the middle of their head, within the scalp, and leave it until it cools.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once a week, along with the other treatment for them, until they are healed; or if you wish, cauterize that area making small punctures according to their tolerance, but hold a cautery instrument so arranged: this is a type of cautery which moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cloth soaked in wool or henbane.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization of descending water in the eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have recognized the beginning of water in the eye, according to the signs I have discussed in the division, then begin and give the patient a drink that will clear their head and protect them from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have him sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then instruct him to shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head;  and then cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of a spreading water in both eyes, or with one cautery on one temple if it is the beginning of water in one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Incise with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are under the skin; and let the cauteries be in that length, in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from him, stop it with any medicine you can.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with knowledge which is in the extraction of arteries and with the excision of them and caution in the stoppage of blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck below two bones with two cauteries directly applied.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old sores.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When sores on the eyelids are chronic and through the veins and arteries which are in the visible area of the forehead, and it is confirmed that this is caused by cold phlegmatic superfluity, then cauterize it with the cautery we described in the chapter on applying warm water to sores, and with a cautery in the middle of the forehead, and with two cauteries on the neck below the temples, and with two cauteries on the neck below the two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if additional treatment is needed, then cauterize the area along the entire eyelid edge, along the eyebrow, with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization of nasal foul odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat it with what we've described in the division and your treatment doesn't work, then prepare and give the patient broth to drink for three nights; and afterward, shave his head and cauterize it with a middling cautery and an olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize the area with a clove-shaped cautery, using two cauteries just above the two eyebrows below the hair, a small one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful of the sparks so that you do not set that on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the clove-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Concerning the cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery with this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize a little on both eyebrows with two cauteries, on every part, and they should be elongated away from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand with the cautery too hard, but according to the amount that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cautery of the eyelid of the eye when the hairs are turned inward and cause the eye to be inflamed.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are turned inward, causing inflammation, cauterization in such cases is done in two ways, either with burning or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a burning cautery, instruct the patient beforehand to remove the hairs as those who groom them, until they are elongated and smoothed out; and if you cauterize them near their origin, then you should tightly bind the eyes with a bandage so that they are not irritated until the hairs have grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, once the hairs have grown back and smoothed out, place the patient's head in your lap, and carefully apply a cautery to the eyelids, using a pointed tool shaped like a leaf of myrtle.  Start the mark near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place cotton soaked in egg white or a ptilli mucilage over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the cautery, which has this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize the marked area, little by little, many times, until the surface of the skin, which is like a myrtle leaf, is completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of successful treatment is that you see the eyelid contracted, and the hairs raised towards the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it for three days, and then place cotton with a bandage over it until the scab is removed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if any cause returns to the root of the hair and the eyelid is softened, then apply the cautery again just as you did before.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are under the eyelid, then cauterize them until they are raised to their natural position, and the wound is healed, and the hairs do not irritate the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine—this is what you command the patient to do: to allow the hairs to grow out and heal, and then a leaf-shaped piece of cloth be made to resemble a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known substances and living oil, or whatever that is, and mix them well, and do this quickly so it does not get cold; and then spread this mixture over the piece of cloth shaped like a myrtle leaf, and place this over the eye, or both eyes; and put a cloth soaked in egg white under the eye, and the patient's head should be supported by you.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger on the medicine and press it a little, and do not remove it until the patient feels the medicine's burning sensation, for the burning sensation is like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, when he perceives the burning sensation, then remove the medicine and wash it away with your finger;  when the burning stops, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water; and then consider if the eyelid has been raised as it should be, having been treated with heat or incision; if so, it is well done; and if not, reapply the medicine to the place where it wasn't applied before, and don't stop until the wound has healed and the eye is sound.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a cloth with a bandage until the burn's inflammation is gone, and then treat it with a healing ointment or something similar until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, following your procedure, to carefully ensure that no medicine gets into the eye.  And if, after a few days, the eyelid becomes softened and some cause of inflammation appears in the eye, then reapply your medicine to the softened part of the eyelid, just as you did at the beginning, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of using myrtle leaves.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that human wounds vary in size and severity, and therefore your treatment should be adjusted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the path to recovery will not be hidden from whoever studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of the cauterization of a fistula in the tear duct of a wound.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the methods discussed in the divisions of diseases, and your treatment isn't working, then you must cauterize it in this manner:  tell the patient to rest their head on your lap, and have an assistant hold the patient's head between your hands, ensuring the head isn't moved or agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a piece of lint soaked in egg white or a poultice of ptilli on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery, which has this shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be concave, like the shape of a reed or a vulture's wing, at the end where the cautery is applied.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should be pointed at the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it should be shaped like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But nevertheless, the concave one is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and drain and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the cautery, which is well-ignited, upon it, and hold your hand a short distance from the cautery from the nose area, so that neither your hand nor the patient is disturbed, and then place the cautery on the root of the wound and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if at the beginning your cautery penetrates into the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; and leave it like that for three days, and then apply a poultice with a bandage and surround it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if more than ten days have passed and it is not healed, then apply an acrid, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and is smooth as appropriate to its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula, which some earlier practitioners said:  Clean the area of the fistula and cauterize it, and then place into that fissure a small quantity of molten lead, which has this form:  And put into it the amount of one ounce of molten lead; and hold your hand firmly over it so the patient is not disturbed, as the molten lead won't enter the wound; and you should place on the wound a poultice soaked in egg white or water, for the lead will adhere to the fistula area and cure it with a remarkable healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a treatment through the nose and to return the fistula to its proper place in the nasal cavity.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of the cauterization of a fissure (or cleft) of the pot (presumably a part of the body, not a cooking vessel).
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times fissures occur in the lips, and especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures with what we have discussed in the divisions and your treatment is not effective, then apply a small, knife-like cautery in this form, as follows:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its (the cautery's) concavity should be according to the sharpness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully place that heated cautery on those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with a plaster until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms at the root of the uvula, or on the palate, or at the roots of the teeth, and a boil develops, and it bursts, and becomes chronic, and forms a fistula, and you treat it but it doesn't respond to treatment, then you should use a heated cautery according to the size of the opening in the fistula, and then place that heated cautery in the fistula's opening, and keep your hand there until the heated iron reaches the bottom of the fistula, and do this one or two times; and then treat it with the cure we previously mentioned until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so, if the diseased tissue is separated and healed, well and good; but if not, then it is necessary to expose the area and remove the corrupted bone according to what is described in its appropriate chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with remedies but there is no improvement, then place the patient's head on your lap, and then heat the cautery in the appropriate shape, so that you place the cannula on the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it, and keep your hand there for a little while so the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and then repeat the cauterization several times as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should fill their mouth with salt water and keep it there for an hour, then spit it out, for the decayed tooth is closed, the softened gums are strengthened, and the corrupted moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold, or there is cold or a worm within, or you do not consider medicinal treatment appropriate, then cauterization in that case is done in two ways: either with cow dung cautery or with fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with cow dung is that you take cow dung, boil it in an iron pot, then take a piece of cloth, wrap it around the end of a stick, dip that in the boiled dung, and quickly place it on the aching tooth until it cools.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat penetrates to the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or cloth in the aforementioned dung, place that on the aching tooth, and hold a heated iron over it until the iron reaches the area of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire is that you use a heated iron or bronze cannula, and it should be of sufficient thickness so that the heat of the fire does not reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery to the desired shape, and place it on the tooth, holding it until the cautery cools; repeat this several times, as the pain may be relieved either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, during the cauterization, the patient fill their mouth with good dung and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out; and this is the manner of the cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize whatever extremity you are able to.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the method of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterization of extrophulos.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophulos are of phlegm and cold humors, and are not yielding to digestion by medicines, and you desire a quick digestion of them, then you heat the cautery, shaped as follows: having two open ends so that smoke escapes from the cautery through one end, and place that heated cautery upon the abscess once, and again if necessary, until it reaches the base of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and then leave it on for three days and place a moistened cloth over it until that which the fire has burned is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment, bandages, and dressings until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or cautery should be suitable for such use.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of hoarseness of voice and constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity affects the airways, especially when it's associated with a cold constitution, the patient should first be treated with laxative medicines, and then cauterized near the root of the throat in the affected area.
