E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And therefore, pierce the conjunctiva with this, and do not press your hand into the hole, but merely make a subtle passageway for the almond.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then introduce the almond, as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And to complete your work, prepare the patient's sleeping quarters properly, where they sleep on their back in a dark room, and prohibit all movement.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And place this on their body so that their nature may be soothed, and do not allow their head to turn to either the right or left at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let the ligament remain according to its disposition until the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then, remove that from the dark room, and shield the patient's vision, and show them some things, and then return the bandage by the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And you should not do this during the time of the treatments or immediately after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	Having done this, you should remove it because the water can easily cause great and vehement damage from watching (or observing).
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an acute abscess occurs, then you should remove the dressing before the seventh day, and treat it with something that will resolve the abscess.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you blindfold the patient and place something over their face through which their gaze is controlled from below for several days, while the patient remains in the darkened room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And then gradually they are released from that room and guided back to their normal activities.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in a serious case, the student is not excused from watching several times, and then you will be skilled in the procedure.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has come to our knowledge from some of those who are at Artach, and some said that a fire was made in the Ayrac, a large hole having been pierced through which the water was drawn out.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	However, I have not seen anyone in our land who has accomplished this, nor have I read it in any of the ancient books; and it is possible that this is new.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the types of magdaam so that he who is ignorant of them might understand them:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made of iron or steel, properly, and their extremities are adorned with this triangular fineness, the tip sharp, just as that is the form.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the treatment of flesh growing in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When various types of flesh grow in the nose, from some cause resembling a very heavy scorpion, or a large polyp; and this disease is called polyps because it resembles that depicted fish.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And from it is cancerous flesh, ulcerous, of dark color; and from it is that which is lion flesh, not of dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore, in those flesh growths that are not fraudulent or cancerous, you should have the patient sit between your hands and expose them to the sun, and dry their nostrils, and prick the growths with your lancet.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then, remove it to the outside, and then cut what you have grasped from those growths with a sharp, thin spathe from one side until you know that all the flesh has been removed; because if any part from which it is possible to excise remains, then you should cut it with one of the thin instruments easily until there remains nothing of it.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it is inflamed with blood or a hot abscess, then you apply what is appropriate; or if it is a malignant abscess, then you cauterize and burn it until the blood is removed and all the cavities are gone.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then, put a mixture of vinegar and water or wine in the nose near the incision.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and moisture proceeds from it to the palate, then you know that it is already healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the moisture does not penetrate as it should, then you know that inside there is flesh or excess pus on the bones of the nostrils to which the excision has not reached.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore, then it is necessary to insert a piece of lint (or similar material) of some thickness, and put many small pieces, placing the amount of a finger or less between each piece, and placing the patient in a position where one end of the lint can be inserted into the nostrils with a probe or other suitable instrument.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after you have done that, cause him to draw his breath in until it reaches the nasal passages, and it emerges over his throat, for many times children in school demonstrate a similar action, and it is an easy thing for one who wishes to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then, place the two ends of the leech, one end extending over the nose and the other remaining inside the nose, and then administer a piece of meat with the nuts contained within the leech, and do this until you know that the meat is now inside the leech's nuts.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then, remove the leech, and place a cautery near the extraction of blood in the nose, and do this for three days or more until the unguent has completely dissolved all remaining flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And finally, place a lead cannula in the nose for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you require a more complete cure, use this one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument for nasal purging, with which oils and medicines are distilled into the nose:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make this of silver or brass, which should resemble a small, open lamp, like a small shell, and similarly shaped at the opening.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed cannula like a tube, and the cannula of the purging instrument should be flat, uncovered; at the rear of which there should be a handle, with which you hold it when heating the oil or water you wish, or juices and subtle substances.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And this nasal purge is potent: take ingredients of castor, white hellebore, ginger, and powdered saffron, long pepper, scammony, and a pinch of spikenard. Mix with juice of beet and sorrel, make them into pills, and dissolve one pill in lukewarm water, then pour it into the nose of the patient lying face down.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of the oils applied to the nostrils.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times oil is applied to the nostrils, and it is magnified and increased over several days until the condition is greatly improved.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And therefore, you must address it at the beginning of its appearance, and eradicate the entire thing.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then place a cautery or a burning medicine on the affected area.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	However, if its treatment is delayed until it has become aggravated, then consider if it is hardened, tough, dark-colored, and insensitive.  If so, do not touch it with iron, for it is a deep-seated abscess; for often, the one who cuts into this abscess risks inflicting great harm upon the afflicted person.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is soft to the touch and not dark-colored, and incision is possible throughout it, then drain the affected area and make the incision without fear, and treat the area with something that dries and tightens until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suturing of the nose, lips, and ear when their continuity is broken by plague or similar illnesses.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when you encounter a break in continuity in one of these cartilages, you accomplish little in that operation except for a few skilled individuals.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you encounter such a condition, consider whether it's fresh plague with its own blood.  If so, you should join the two sides of the wound with stitches and then treat it until it heals.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the edges of the broken skin are already separated, and each is healthy, then it is necessary for you to scrape away each portion of their visible scabs until blood comes out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then join the two edges with stitches, tightening them, and sprinkle dragon's blood and crushed asafoetida over them.  Place a piece of diaphanous plaster, or another of the consolidating plasters, over the powder, and leave it bound for two or three days.  Then remove it and change the plaster, leaving it until the pus is completely gone, and then treat with ointment until healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the method of stitching is that you should either join the broken skin with needles as we have described in the suturing of the belly, or you should join it with glue, as we have explained to you.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those things that appear between the two lips in the interior parts.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Often, in the inner parts of the lips of men, some hard abscesses appear, resembling the grains of millet, and some of them are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you must turn the lips over and cut away each of those hardnesses from all sides. Then, with sharp instruments, you should fill the area with pressed, dried sawdust until the bleeding is stopped. Then, the area should be washed with sharp wine and treated with something astringent until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of the incision of the flesh adhered to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Often, flesh adhered to the gums, which the ancients called "albulus," is present.  Then you should detach it with a forceps or scissors, and cut it away from its roots, allowing the pus or blood to drain.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then apply pressed, dried sawdust, or other astringent or drying powders to the area.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then cut it away again, and cauterize it, for the cautery will now prevent its return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Concerning the extraction of teeth with an iron instrument.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth, both on the inner and outer parts, and between the gums, rough, hard, and sometimes black or yellowish crusts form, and the gums become inflamed by this, and the teeth become loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore, you should position the patient between your hands, placing their head on your lap, and carefully extract those teeth on which such crusts and similar, gritty substances appear, until no trace of them remains, thus removing the blackness, yellowness, and other impurities.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	If you have removed what was present at the beginning of the procedure, then good; if not, then repeat the procedure on those teeth the next day, and the following day, and a third time, until they reach the desired state.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth require many tools of various shapes and forms, depending on what is needed for your procedure.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore, the file used to file the tooth from the inside is different from the file used to file between the teeth, in other shapes, and these files should be prepared by you, which you will see shortly.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of the removal of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	You must treat the tooth's pain with all diligence and take your time in any tooth extraction, because there is no remedy that surpasses the time spent on it when it is extracted, because it is a subtle substance until the extraction is completed.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	However, when the patient requires that tooth to be extracted, you must be firmly certain which tooth is the painful one, for many times the pain deceives the patient and indicates that it is in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one, and the pain does not cease until the diseased and painful tooth is extracted, for we have already seen this through the operations of barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, how must you be certain which tooth is painful, and that you know it well? Then you must scrape around the tooth with a substance having some virtue until it is detached from the gum on every side, and then gently remove it with your fingers, or with very fine forceps, little by little, until you have removed it completely.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then, if it requires strong forceps for good grip or sturdy structure, place the patient's head between your knees so you hold it securely and then pull out the tooth straight so you do not break it, and do not cause further pain to the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore, if it is not easily removed, then take one of those instruments and place it under it from every side with ease and exert the removal just as you did at first.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is cracked or decayed, then you must cover the crack with cloth and compress it with a fine pointed instrument so that it does not break during the process of removing it with forceps.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you must carefully scrape around the entire gum area, and keep a strong grip so that you do not break it and leave a piece, and return the patient to the harm that could be worse than the initial pain.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their eagerness and boldness in tooth extraction, without administering what we have described; for often they cause serious illnesses in men that are more difficult to treat, leaving the roots all, or some of them, remaining, or even pulling out some jawbone with the tooth, as we have witnessed many times.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And after the extraction, the mouth should be rinsed with warm wine or vinegar with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is excessive bleeding, as often happens, then apply a bit of wool and sprinkle it over the wound, and if that doesn't stop it, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps and delicate pliers used to begin removing the tooth should be long on the end, with a short, thick handle, so that they do not bend when using them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And they should be like a thick handle, so that when you squeeze with them, they don't bend; have short ends.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they should be made of Indian steel, with straight ends, and on those ends there should be teeth which interlock and grip tightly with strong constriction; and sometimes the ends of those have the shape of a stork's beak, that is, a hook, and are very constricting.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of the removal of teeth and extraction of bones from fractured jaws.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must remove a broken tooth which remains in place, you should apply a cloth soaked in hot water for a day or two until the area is softened; then, grasp the tooth with forceps, whose tips are shaped like the beak of a stork (or a hook), the shape of a pair of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The tips of the forceps should be made with a file or emery.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you cannot extract the tooth with these forceps or pliers, then you must carefully dig around the root and expose all the flesh, and insert an instrument called a small lever, which is shaped like this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And it should have a short, thick end, a little bit, so that it is not broken.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if the root is thus pulled out, good; and if not, help yourself with these other instruments, of which these are the shapes: the shape of the first instrument is triangular-ended, of some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it should be triangular and have a more slender tip.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And having already been helped with this instrument with two ramps, the shape of which is approximately as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments, which I will describe in detail later; for assistance is given with this instrument, which resembles a large hook, and this is the form:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of a triangular, bent or short tip, which has some thickness, and which should not be too sharp so that it does not break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And you should know that the instruments for the teeth are very similar to the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	However, a skilled and clever craftsman in the art will discover for himself, according to what the operation and the various illnesses indicate to him; for there are illnesses for which the ancients did not prescribe or create a specific instrument, due to the diverse forms of the conditions.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the bone of the jaw or other bones in the mouth are fractured or diseased, then it should be treated in its place with whatever is appropriate from the instruments and forceps we have described for the extraction of tooth roots, and it will be helpful with a technique, whose form is this:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And it should be gradually reduced in size, and held or squeezed with the mouth so that it does not escape or loosen until the entire bone is fully repositioned; then restore the area with appropriate remedies for this.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	However, if there is a small swelling on the bone, then remove that swelling and its blackness, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the treatment of teeth protruding beyond the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth protrude beyond their natural position, causing an uneven shape, especially in women, and particularly in young women, you must consider: if a tooth is close to another tooth, and separation or a ligature is not possible, then extract that tooth; but if it is not connected to another tooth, then you should cut it with this instrument, the shape of which is like a pig's snout, made of Indian iron with a very sharp tip.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And make your incision with the instrument, cutting into the tooth over several days due to its hardness, so that it does not damage other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the protruding tooth is exposed for filing, then file it with an Indian iron file of this shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should be entirely made of Indian iron, and easily tempered; and it should have many small points, just like the file used to make needles, with which the tooth can be filed little by little over many days with ease, so that no other tooth is damaged or broken.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then carefully line it up at the end, and cut it (the tooth) out using a few razors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if a part of the tooth is fractured and hurts the tongue, then you must file it down until the roughness of that fracture is removed and smoothed, and it is made whole so that the tongue is not injured and speech is not impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of restoring damaged teeth with gold or silver fillings.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When teeth are fractured or dislodged by impact or a blow, and the patient cannot properly bite down, and you have treated it with astringent medicines, and your treatment has not been successful, then, in order to prevent it from rotting, the gaps should be filled with gold, not silver, because silver turns green and may rot after a few days, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the filling should be of such a thinness and thickness according to the amount that can fit between the teeth; and the method of insertion is to take the filling and place double that amount between two healthy teeth, then gradually increase the amount with two curves of the filling between the damaged teeth, whether one or many, until the material reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then repeat the insertion until the starting point, and gently and skillfully compress it until it is no longer damaged.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your grip, with which you compress the filling, must be on the roots of the teeth so that it does not come loose.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then you trim the excess filling with forceps or nippers, and adjust them in each place with skill, and shape and hide them between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth, so as not to injure the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then leave it thus tightly fitted as it remains.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or broken, compress it or them with more filling in such a way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the method for teeth and the method of repairing two healthy and two damaged teeth, thus when these are joined:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when one or two teeth are returned to the fitting of each in their places, and they have grown back as we have recounted, and remain.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And only skilled and knowledgeable craftsmen can do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes a substitute is made from the bones of a cow, shaped like a tooth, and placed in the gap where the tooth is missing, and compressed as we said, and it remains and serves as a replacement for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the binding of the ligament which is in the tongue and prevents speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament, which sometimes lies under the tongue, is either natural, present from birth, or accidental and caused by a wound that has healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on it involves opening the patient's mouth, their head held securely by you; lifting their tongue, and then carefully cutting that nerve ligament along its width until the tongue is released from its confinement.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	However, if there is any hardness or knotting there, resulting from the healing of a wound, then apply a cauterizing agent and cut along its width until you have severed the ligament and the knot has dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful not to create a tear in the flesh and that the cut doesn't go too deep, causing excessive bleeding.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the cut with water or vinegar or cold water; and then place a linen pad under the tongue; this is a bandage the patient will wear under the tongue every night to prevent it from sticking again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if bleeding occurs, place powdered vitriol on the area; but if the bleeding persists, then cauterize the area with a blunt cautery suitable for this.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with the other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the removal of a ranula (a cyst) under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes, an abscess forms under the tongue, resembling a small tumor, hindering the tongue's natural function; and it grows significantly until it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the treatment for it is to open the patient's mouth, sitting facing the sun, and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it [the abscess] of a dark color, or black, hard, to which the patient does not feel sensitivity, then do not touch that which is cancer.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it has turned to a whitish color, in which there is moisture, then you insert your forceps there, and make an incision with a thin scalpel, and cut it from every side; and if blood comes out during your operation, then you place over it crushed egg white, i.e. vitriol, until the bleeding is controlled.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work until you have extracted it completely, until it is washed with vinegar and salt; and treat it with other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of abscesses in the two ears, and that which is on the neck, and other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess develops on the neck, it's often glands that are swollen and inflamed.  These become external and are called 'the two ears'; if you treat them with what we've said in the discussion and they don't heal, then you must consider if the abscess is hard, dark-colored, and insensitive.  If so, do not touch it with an iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is reddish and the root is thick, then do not touch it with iron for fear of blood flow. Instead, let it mature; then either you will lance it or it will break open on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is white, soft, and its root is thin, then it is suitable to be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it requires you to consider, before your operation, whether the abscess has already been softened by complete rest or if it has diminished with any reduction. Then, have the patient sit in the sun, with their head in your lap, and open their mouth. The attendant should grasp and press down the patient's tongue with a very fine instrument, which has this form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or bronze, and be thin like a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	So, as you press the tongue with it, and the abscess is shown to you, and you have placed your gaze upon it, then take a lancet and place it on the abscess, and draw it outwards to the sides as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	After you have drawn some of the tissues, then cut that with an instrument of this form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it resembles forceps, but its ends are curved, so that the opening of each is facing the other, very sharp, which should be made of tempered iron.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not present, then cut it with a scalpel, of which this is the form: And it should be sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have incised one incision, cut the other following this same method of incision, and then the patient will recover from cold water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	However, if there is bleeding, treat with water decoction of pomegranate bark or myrtle leaves, or similar astringents, until the bleeding is reduced, and then treat it until healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes other abscesses arise in the throat or near the two ears, and incise them as I have described in the incision of two incisions above.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I once treated a woman with an abscess that had formed in her throat, an abscess that was tending towards a dark color, with little sensation, which had already narrowed her throat, and the woman was breathing with a constricted airway, and had been forbidden from eating and drinking water, and she would have died if it had lasted just one or two more days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had grown so much that it had formed two channels before bursting through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore, I treated it fistularly, and placed a probe into one of the openings, and pulled it out, and a large portion came out with it, and then I cut that from where it connected to the other opening, and then I opened her mouth, and held her tongue down, and then I placed the probe into that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I excised a large portion of it, and only a little blood flowed from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore, the woman's throat was completely healed, and she immediately began drinking water, and then eating food.  Thus, I did not cease to cut into that abscess many times for a long time, and another abscess succeeded in its place, which I also cut into until it was resolved.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore, I cauterized the throat of her, thus bringing relief; and then I wandered and did not know what God had done to her nearby me.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of the incision of a boil when it is suppurated.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When a sore throat affects the uvula, and it is suppurated and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is in the lower part, thick and round, then it is called a boil.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	However, when it is cured with what we have said in the division, and you do not confirm your cure, and sometimes a suppurating boil is already subdued and subtle, then you must incise that which is swollen and round; and if it is of that length, and is bloody, dark-colored or black, and is not sensitive to touch, then you must attempt its incision, for there is a fear for the patient in that.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it according to the way I have described, by its whiteness and length, you should have the patient sit down and press the tongue with an instrument that displays its shape and then place the lancet on the new boil, pull it downwards, and incise it with one of the two instruments that we call 'incising two boils'.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you must not incise it except what is aligned with the natural boundary without addition, for if you incise further, you will worsen its condition.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, use what we have described in the incision of two boils, and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the patient is frightened by the incision, you should use cauterization without fear, and the method of cauterization there is only with sharp water.  You should place the patient's head on your lap, then press their tongue with the instrument we mentioned, and then take the water, as described in the chapter on cauterization, and apply it with a burning stick.  Do not use a thick or thin layer, and fill the cavity of the instrument, which is shaped like [… (the description of the instrument's shape is missing)].
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the extremity of it [the instrument] be concave, like the bowl of a spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine over the wound.  The patient should lie on their side so that saliva or mucus from the mouth flows away from the medicine, so that nothing drips down the throat and irritates it.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then, hold your hand with the medicine, and press it on the uvula for half an hour, until you see it blackened and calmed by the medicine's action.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a piece of cloth and wrap it around the end of the [medical] instrument, dip the cloth in the medicine, and insert the instrument with the cloth-covered end into a tube or canal until the cloth adheres to it.  Do this many times until you achieve the desired cauterization of the uvula. Then, leave it to dry and fall off in about three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, repeat it.  Then, after the cauterization, clean the area around the uvula with a cloth soaked in water or broth, removing any remaining medicine.  Wash with cold water and treat the outside with a soothing ointment, and internally with remedies until healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this type of treatment is safer than incision and less prone to complications.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is treated with a method more delicate than cauterization or incision, through fumigation in this way: take balm, hyssop, origanum, rue, Arabic cicuta, chamomile, rosemary, and similar herbs, and combine all of them, or some of them, in a pot, and immerse them in sour wine and bring to a boil. The pot should be properly sealed, and a hole in the center of the pot should have a concave brass instrument placed over it, be it made of silver or brass.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the end [of the instrument] should be inserted into the patient's mouth until the vapor rises to the uvula through the tube, until the uvula is considerably softened.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat this many times until it [the uvula] is dry.  Be careful not to use this treatment at the beginning of an abscess, for it would only worsen the abscess;  you should not do this unless the abscess is already hot.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then take a reed and place a hard-boiled egg shell at its end, so that the patient's mouth is covered; for the egg shell prevents the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of the removal of thorns and of that which adheres to the throat, and of other similar matters.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Often thorns or fish bones or some other thing adhere to the throat.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you should remove what is clearly visible, focusing on it.  Press the tongue with an instrument in front of the light, so that what is in the throat is revealed to you.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is hidden in the throat, you must make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, for a foreign object adhering to the throat will be expelled by vomiting; or have the patient swallow a piece of bread or lettuce root or a piece of dry bread; or let the patient take a piece of dry sea sponge, tightly wrapped in wool, and then the patient swallows this, for as it reaches the place where the thorn is, it will be expelled.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And further, take an eel and drink it, wrapped in wool, and place it inside [the throat] and it will be drawn out; or take a leek and place it inside, and then draw it out.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if it is not expelled by those methods we have mentioned, then use a lead instrument in this way:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be slightly larger than a small finger, and at its end there should be a concavity that you can easily insert into the patient's throat.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And have the patient raise their head, and be careful not to touch their throat bone, so that it does not hurt, and with that [instrument] push on the bone or thorn, or the physician with their hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But the patient should, with their knowledge of the location of the cause, gently push downwards, and pull their hand with the instrument upwards, all according to the amount that is prepared until it is expelled.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of a bloodsucker attached to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the leech is medicated with what we have said in the division of treatment with medicines and it doesn't work, then consider the area of the patient's throat in the sun, after you have pressed the patient's tongue with an instrument as we have described.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the leech, extract it with a small knife or with gentle, skillful movements.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible to remove it with that, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's throat.  Then place a heated iron in the concavity of the cannula, and do this repeatedly (until the leech is dead and detached from the throat).  Keep the patient away from water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Then take a bowl filled with cold water, and open the patient's mouth into it, and wash the mouth with it; and do not allow the patient to swallow anything and hold the water for another hour with your hand, for the leech, as soon as it feels the water, will fall off.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not dislodged by what we have described, then fumigate the patient with incense or asafoetida using the instrument we described for fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that it will fall off.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And another method of fumigation for that is that you take a bowl containing burning coals, and the bowl is covered with a cover in the middle of which is a hole, and the tip of the instrument is placed in that hole.  Then you must perform the fumigation above it; and place the patient's mouth on the tip of the cannula, and close their mouth to ensure the fumigation does not escape until you know that it has reached the leech, for the leech will fall off as soon as the fumigation reaches it.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall off, then you repeat the fumigation many times, and prevent the patient from drinking, and have them eat salty things and herbs, and do not allow them to drink water, and with this treatment it will be necessary for it to be expelled.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the shape of the instrument with which the leech from the throat is treated when it is visible; and it is similar to forceps in some ways, but it has a slight curve in some places.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed on the throat, and its tip is similar to a stork's beak, which is smooth, on which a file is used, so that when we grasp something, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the discourse on the appearance of abscesses and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are of many types, in many ways, according to their appearance, each one described in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their puncture and incision, in two ways, of which one is according to the type of abscess itself; and due to the moisture we grasp.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is according to the places on the body where they occur, for the abscess that occurs in the head is different from the abscess that occurs in the buttocks; and the abscess in a fleshy area is different from the abscess that occurs in a joint; and for each of these, there is a specific treatment.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And some abscesses must not be incised until the pus has matured within them, or until they are fully developed.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Some other abscesses should be lanced while they are inflamed and have not matured, such as those near joints.  For, when an abscess is near a joint, its growth extends until it could damage the surrounding tissue, and the ligaments or nerves of that joint are easily corrupted, causing the limb to contract.  Or, if the abscess is near a vital part of the body, delay in lancing it until maturity could harm the vital area.  Or, if it's near the anus, lance it even if it isn't fully mature.  Do not lance an unripe, incompletely digested one, but one near the anus, so you do not rupture it and cause an extension of the problem into the internal parts of the anus and create a fistula, or cause harm to the surrounding area which won't heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But you must know the time to lance the abscess, and that is when it is mature.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	You will know it is mature when the pain subsides, the fever ceases, the swelling and throbbing decrease, the head of the abscess becomes firmer, and other similar signs appear.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because you must lance the abscess in the pus-filled area below it, and from the swelling's drainage.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And always make the incision along the length of the flesh or body, if the abscesses are in the areas of the hands or feet, and in locations away from the tendons, nerves, and arteries; and, in all similar areas where there is no reflex action.  For, in those places that are reflex-sensitive, use a method of incision appropriate to that specific body part.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	However, when the abscess is in a fleshy area, it is better to leave it until its digestion is confirmed, as we have said, for if you lance it before that, you prolong the patient's suffering, add to the dirt, and make the abscess walls hardened and deep.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses must be lanced across the breadth of the flesh or body, depending on the need or the specific requirements of the affected limb.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you must administer a small incision for small abscesses, and a large, wide incision, or multiple incisions, depending on the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are abscesses in which the boil must be hollowed out and incised when it is ready, as when dealing with swellings and boils.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And some are incised with a three-sided cut; and some are incised in the shape of a myrtle leaf, as are the abscesses of the joints.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And some are treated with a round incision and a crescent-shaped incision, and similar ones.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But those in which no such procedure is appropriate, like superficial abscesses, you should pierce with a superficial, or simple, incision.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has collected much pus, you should pierce it and not try to remove all the matter at once; having removed a portion, then close the abscess until the next day, and then remove a larger portion, and repeat this many times according to the degree until it is entirely discharged.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is weak, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or an elderly person in decline, for the animal spirit is often weakened by the discharge of pus, and the patient often dies quickly, and you must proceed cautiously.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Observe this chapter with great caution, and for your incision in which you pierce these abscesses, you should clean the sores and consider whether the abscess wound is small, or a simple incision, then apply ointments of lead or old linen; and if the abscess is large and the fissures of the incision are many, then you must place medicaments in each opening until they join together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the skin has been separated or has been incised around the circumference, then you should fill it with old linen or cloth thread, as when you have removed bread or roots, without moisture; and keep it tight until the third day; and then you should process it and treat it with the appropriate ointments until it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if blood flows during your procedure, then apply cold water and vinegar in which you have dipped a linen cloth, and place this over the site of the blood flow repeatedly.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the blood flow persists, then you must administer treatment and remedies, and powders which have been recounted in many places in this book and in various divisions.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is wintertime, and the location of the abscess is a place with many nerves, then you must soak powders in warm wine and oil, and apply those to the affected areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer, and the areas are fleshy, then you must apply powders soaked in water and oil, or wine and oil, and all this should remain cold until the third day, as we have said.  Then you must open the abscess, cleanse it, and apply the appropriate treatment until it heals.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the understanding of the treatment of abscesses in general; but according to the method of distinction that I have already mentioned, the treatment of each type of abscess is described in individual chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the lancing of abscesses which arise on the neck of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	Small abscesses occur on the neck of the head, and these are of the nature of lumps that contain membranes surrounding them; and the content of these lumps is pus.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they have pus, and that pus contains a moisture resembling lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And some contain a moisture resembling dust, and some are like them; and some are hard, like stones.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the lancing of all of them, and in the extraction of these, there is no fear, as the extraction of these does not cause contrary arrows.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the surgical procedure for lancing these is that you probe them with an instrument whose shape is similar to this, which is called a lancet, until you know what they contain.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is moisture, then you cut it with a lengthwise incision, a superficial incision in this manner:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin the incision along line B to line G.  Then, once the moisture is drained, scrape away the skin that contained the moisture, and leave no remnants of it at all, for it often returns if any part remains.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then, soak some cotton in Egyptian ointment, if available, or else in water and salt; and fill the wound with that and leave it until the next day, for this will corrode any remaining skin remnants.
