E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other wounds on other limbs, the treatment is similar to what we have described.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of wounds of the abdomen.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The ailment that occurs in the abdomen is either severe, mild, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	In severe cases, sometimes the intestine or nerve of the intestine is involved, requiring a more forceful and precise suturing of the affected areas.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small rupture is difficult to manage in a different way, and the reduction of the parts is more difficult if you don't quickly return the displaced parts to their place, for if it opens and swells, the return becomes difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	Therefore, the best type of rupture is a moderate one, because in that case, the reduction of the intestine is not difficult, unlike the two types mentioned before.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that the suturing of the abdomen is done in four ways, but two of these methods are common and applicable to the suturing of other wounds on the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	Two other specific methods are also applicable to other wounds, yet they are even more specific to suturing the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I will explain each to you with an exposition and a declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, I say that when the wound is small and some part of the intestine has come out through it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then this is one of two ways: either due to the smallness of the rupture as we have said, or when the intestine has become inflamed due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore, when this is the case, you should warm the area by submerging a damp sponge or cloth in lukewarm water alone, or by using water with squinant, cyperus, and spic, and apply that to the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes, doing this with a styptic is better than using water alone in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And when you see the inflammation resolved, then moisten the intestine with water in which the plant althea and mallow have been boiled, for by this the intestine's discomfort is relieved with little effort.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the intestine's discomfort is eased by this treatment, then carefully cut the rupture slightly with an instrument with which hemorrhoids are incised.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better, when it is proper and involves no incision, and there is no need for or attempt at cutting when there is necessity and weakness.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, here is its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it is sharply curved, and the other part is not sharp, and the tip is slender, and it should not be as slender as a spatula, but rather slightly blunt.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore, when the rupture is enlarged and the intestine is out, then its reduction must be according to its natural form, in its proper place, if possible, for that is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the rupture is wide and is in the lower part of the abdomen, then you must have the patient lie on their back, and raise their legs higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the abdomen, then you raise the head and feet higher than the lower parts.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly, if the rupture is in one of the two parts of the abdomen, then constantly pay attention and consider this, so that the part where the rupture is positioned is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus you must administer this in large ruptures and in medium-sized ones.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small ruptures, place what you have prepared, and then have the assistant hold the rupture entirely with their hand and bring the edges together, and then uncover that area in case there is another cause to the suture.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suture: one takes the needle, or several needles depending on the size of the rupture; then place the tip of the needle at the edge of the rupture on the ring finger, and hold the needle firmly so you do not pull it on the two ends of the ligament, with the two ends of the stitch under the ligament on the inside, until you have made it penetrate that area; and you have now joined the two ends of the ligament and two ends of the stitch, which is done in four stages.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	Then tighten with a double thread around the needle, and sometimes from two sides together, and then bring the two edges and the rupture together in a fitting way; then leave the thickness of the finger and place another needle there, and then tie it with thread, just as you did with the first needle; and do not stop doing this if necessary with needles until you have completed the entire constriction of the rupture.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be medium in thickness and fineness, because thin needles easily pierce the flesh, and thick ones are difficult to insert into the ligament, and therefore they should be of medium fineness and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And the needle should not be inserted too close to the two ends of the ligament, so that the flesh is not pierced easily and the wound opens before it heals.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And the sutures should not be too long, so that the wound is not prevented from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	Then trim the ends of the needles so that they do not disturb the patient's sleep; and place expanding powders on the sutures, covering the ends of the needles, and leave them there until you know the wound is healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this method of stitching with needles is most suitable for small wounds, for one or two needles, or around that number, are enough for the suture.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second suture is more common: and it is that you stitch the four ends of the ligament and two ends of the cyst at once, with a needle that is well-wrapped in both thinness and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then, when you have pierced these four ends with the needle, return the needle to the same starting point from which you began, so that the thread retracts from the most superior part of the wound, so that the suture is like a fabric stitch with which the fabric is tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And place the width of a little finger between each stitch.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture is known to men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with such a suture, I closed the wound which had befallen a man in his belly, who had been wounded with a knife.  The wound was a tear larger than a palm, and the intestines had protruded about two palms from the middle area of the intestine, and the rupture was in the middle of the member; and then I reduced that protrusion after the intestines had been outside for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was consolidated in fifteen days or so, and I cured him and he was healed; and afterwards he lived for many years, and recovered his former condition.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other physicians had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle he was, for I did not cure him with ointments, for it was in a place where no ointment or medicine was found, but I placed linen cloths over the wound twice a day and diligently washed it with honeyed water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will tell you two kinds of sutures, proper according to the narration of the Word.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with a suture of the cord, and thread the needle from the outside to the inside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And so, as the needle penetrates the cord and the same wound, according to its length and the entire body, leave the end of the thread where you have threaded the needle; and make the needle penetrate the other end from the inside to the outside in the other end of the wound.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have made that penetration, then you make that penetrate again in that same end of the wound from the outside to the inside; and leave the end of the thread that is in this loop, and make the needle penetrate the other end of the wound from the inside to the outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make penetration with that your penetration with which you make that penetration into the thread at the wound's end, which is on the patient's side, until all of that is penetrated.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then begin from this same side and stitch that with the thread end on the other side, and pull the needle out of the cord which it penetrated, and then return that into that cord and stitch the thread end that is on the other side with this wound end; and pull that out of the cord which is on his side.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do that once and again, and do that once again until you sew everything that is outside according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suture is that you sew with a skin suture, with which you stitch the skins, in such a way that you stitch the thread one time from the end of the cord, and leave that other time until you have completed it.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	However, the second type of proper suture, which is also called Gallic, and this is as he and for him recounted, is that you stitch it in a similar way to how some healers stitch it, in such a way that they add each part to its corresponding part on him, as is appropriate by nature; and they apply the end of one to the end of the wound, and this is done according to what I have recounted to you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	You must place the needle into the wound end close to the external part, and make it penetrate into the internal part of the wound, and leave two ends of the thread; and then turn the needle and make it penetrate from outside to inside in two parts of the thread.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then turn each of those, and make each penetrate from the inside to the outside in two other ends of the wound on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suture is better than the common, simple suture, and is the suture of which we previously spoke.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the Gallic method.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And yet some may say, the suture of the belly is rectified with two needles, which means you place a thread through each, and begin by inserting the needle from your side, and make it penetrate to the other side, according to a suture that joins the layers of skin equally.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when the rupture is in the middle of the belly, then the suture there is more difficult than in other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of the treatment for plague is the same as for other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which means that when you catch the plague early, before the air alters it, and you return the bowel and sew it up properly, then place the flesh-restoring powder on it.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then apply some ointments that are readily available to you until they form a hard scab and the pus drains, and are firm and sealed; and then treat it as you would treat other plagues until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you don't have the medicines available, then apply this immediately, as soon as it begins to pus, old cloth, and change it twice a day, as you have been taught, until it is healed, for you do not need other medication in many cases when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague is spreading to the main limbs, then you should soak lion's wool in high-quality olive oil, or scented oil, and place it around the areas between the armpits and below the elbows.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if you feel pain or putrefaction in their bowels, which often happens, then treat it with black astringent wine, and especially if the inflammation has reached the bowel and has made a penetrating exit into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that that which is in the large bowel is easier to heal than that which is in the small bowels.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal, for the bowel called "jejunum" does not receive healing from any plague that affects it completely; and this is due to the large number of veins in it, and because of its large size within those, and due to the subtlety of its structure, and due to its proximity to the nature of the nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if the result of the plague is a membrane, and you find it fresh, return it according to your method of returning the bowels as well.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has gone further and has already turned green or black, then you should squeeze it with a cloth on the area where it is discolored, to cause a flow of blood, for there are veins and arteries in the membrane.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And then cut whatever is attached to that ligament, and hang the two ends of the cloth from below the wound to alleviate the pulling of it away from the wound and the expulsion of the plague's branch (or limb).
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	A reminder of the plagues when they occur in the bowel.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a rupture occurs in the bowel, and it is small, it is possible that it can be restored in some people.  For example, I saw a man who had been wounded in his belly with a spear thrust, and the plague was on the right side of his stomach.  The plague was old and had become a fistula, and he expelled gas and wind.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then I considered his treatment, although it wasn't guaranteed to heal him, but I continued to refine it until he was healed and the area was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I, having seen the area healed, inquired about any further ailments in his stomach.  No further ill effects occurred, and he remained in good condition, eating and drinking, and then he entered a bath and was exercised, as prescribed.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced practitioners have said that when a wound occurs in the bowel, if it is small, it should be bound in this way: you should take ants with large heads;  then close the two edges of the wound, and place one of those ants with an open mouth over the edges of the wound. When it bites and closes its mouth, cut off its head, as it adheres and does not dissolve.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	Then place another ant near the first, and do not cease to do this with ants, one after another, according to the size of the entire wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And then you compress that and hold it to the wound; and those ant heads remain attached to the bowel until the bowel is healed; and you do no harm to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is also possible to bind the bowel with a fine thread made from the bowel of an animal attached to it, after it is put on a needle;  you take the end of this bowel thread, it should be very thin, then bind the end to the thread, wrapped around it, then insert that thread through needles and, using that needle, compress the bowel and return it to the opening.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this method of suturing with ants is only a way of trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	However, if the wound is large and extensive, especially if it is in one of the delicate intestines, for then there is only refinement, and not a complete healing of it.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the treatment of abscesses and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that any wound or abscess, when it grows old and becomes an ulcer, and is not healed and continually discharges pus and is not excised, then, in any limb, it is universally called a fistula and we do not call it an abscess in that case.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And a fistula, in truth, is a hard, white, fibrous swelling, with no pain and a cavity like the cavity of a bird's quill; and therefore that ulcer is called a *rizatz* (or *rizat*), that is, a quill.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And in some people it is moist, discharging pus; and easily the moisture is excised in a few hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is thick, and sometimes thin, and sometimes large, and sometimes small.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already said before, in the division, when I described the wounds, that any ulcer that is not healed nor is on healthy flesh, is only so for one of these reasons: either through lack of blood in the body; or because of a bad constitution; or because hardened flesh between the wound and the edges is preventing the growth of flesh; or because the wound is excessively light or flimsy; or because the ulcer itself is putrid and the material sent to it is of bad quality; or because the treatment is unsuitable; or when corruption develops in the region, and there is pestilence; or because of the region's own characteristics, as in Saragossa, where digestion of illnesses is difficult, and healing of abscesses is delayed by nature; or because there is bone, or many bones, in it.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all those causes, and the signs of them, and the treatment of them with medicines in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And it is necessary that I make you understand the treatment of a fistula that is created through surgical intervention with the hands.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And understand that fistulas occur in all parts of the body; for among them are fistulas that reach large veins and arteries, or nerves, or the spine, or the intestines, or the bladder, or to one of the ribs, or one of the vertebrae of the spine, or to one of the joints, which are compound, such as the hand and foot; and of these are those that occur near the main limb and of similar nature.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	Therefore, among these fistulas, which are of this type, are among the illnesses with difficult healing, and do not receive a cure, and dealing with them is effort and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if any of these fistulas does not reach the locations I have mentioned, and you hope and trust in its cure, and want to gain knowledge of it, then take a probe of iron or steel, and if the fistula goes in a straight path, you will find it with it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is winding, then investigate it with a probe of fine lead, for lead, due to the lightness of its body, is easily bent and guided toward the winding.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has many roughnesses, it is not possible for you to mark it with a probe.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then irrigate the orifices with their orifices, for the moisture through which you irrigate it flows toward the other openings and runs through them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then carefully investigate, according to what method is possible for you, to know if there is bone or nerve there, and whether the fistula's cavity is distant or close, or if it is a fistula with many orifices and it is all over that, with the full force of your attention, your questioning, with which you question the patient, and the location of the pain with your hand on the spot, and similar to the meanings and causes that apply to an abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all those points with true judgment, then proceed to treatment according to your knowledge.  Consider whether the fistula is a superficial or near-surface fistula or one in a salty area, distant from a joint, nerve, artery, vein, or one of the locations I have mentioned to you.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then, dry the fistula as previously described, removing the filtering material and corrupted flesh, and whatever has grown from the flesh's opening or from there and similar things, and treat it until healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is deep and located, as was mentioned, then it is necessary to cut it, as far as possible for you, and remove all its corrupted flesh.  Then administer some compresses with sharp medicines, and place them inside the fistula's cavity, which you have opened with an iron instrument.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this repeatedly until the sharp medicine dissolves everything that remains in the fistula's cavity from the corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	Then restore it with ointments that produce healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by this, then you cauterize it as we have described.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	However, if the fistula's cause is bone, and you are sure of this, then you must incise and cauterize it as we have described, unless you believe that any vein, nerve, or major limb is in the way, as we have mentioned.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is some corruption or blackness on it, then you scrape away that corruption completely; and then cure it with something that will create flesh until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and continues to fester as before, then know that you have not achieved complete eradication of the corruption; and then you must once more uncover it, thoroughly excavate and cleanse it with your strongest tools, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And if it is healed, well and good; but if not, then know that this corruption lies deep within the body, a condition that cannot be reached, and thus there is no remedy but to leave it be.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or if you can, you should remove it with fine forceps suitable for this purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then meticulously remove all of them, and leave nothing behind with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if any moisture causes you difficulty, and there is no fear or mistake in their incision, then incise those ligaments or flesh if present, and free the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones immediately, then place something on the wound that can keep the wound closed, and leave it until the area around those bones is free of flesh and ligaments, and keep the wound from healing and make the incision you have made firm during your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	However, if you fear it, place cotton soaked in oil, or cotton soaked in Egyptian ointment, or any green ointment on it, because when those ligaments soften, and the bones are separated from them, their removal is easier.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone, like a leg bone or thigh bone, or similar, and only the surface of it is corrupted, then scrape it with a rasp until that blackness and corruption are removed, and then repair the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if the corrupted portion is large, and the corruption has already reached the bone marrow, then it is necessary to cut the affected area entirely,  incision by incision, until the corruption is reached, and then treat it until it heals.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you what happened to a man in his thigh, so that you may use it as an example and help for your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	There was a young man, around 30 years of age, who experienced pain in his thigh.  And from the internal parts, there was an accumulation of matter within the body until it reached the thigh.  This was a matter of a large abscess, and it was not caused by an external factor.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then, because of the doctors' error, the condition was allowed to develop over time until the abscess opened, and a large amount of matter came out.  Its treatment was delayed until the leg became fistulaed, and many openings formed which all discharged pus and bodily humours.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And so, many doctors treated him over two years, and none of them had the expertise in the art, until I was called in.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw his leg and the matter flowing from those openings in great quantity; and already the man's body was all wasted away, and his complexion was yellow.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	Then I inserted a probe into one of those openings, and the probe reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I probed all the openings and found them leading to various parts of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I incised one of those openings until I uncovered a portion of the bone, and found it decayed, already turning to earth and blackened; and a portion of the leg was already decaying, having penetrated to the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I closed what I had uncovered of the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I judged that it was not the bone itself, but that decay which I had cut away and closed, and I had already removed it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I applied restorative medicine to the wound with consolidating remedies for a long time, but it did not heal.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I reopened and uncovered the bone a second time, after the first uncovering, and found continuing decay along with the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I removed what appeared to me as that decay, and then I was forced to perform the healing and restoration of it, but it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I uncovered it again, and did not cease to cut into the bone little by little, particularly, and forced the restoration of it, but it was not restored until I cut away about a palm's width of it, and extracted the marrow along with it.  Then I restored that area with medicines, and it was slightly consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And further operations and cutting into it are not necessary, except due to the weakness of the patient, and the small amount of tolerance and fear of death, for in those hours, a harmful fainting spell occurred due to excessive evacuation.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And so, it is healed completely, and nothing is in place of the bone but hard flesh; and its placement within the body is good, and its strength returned; and it has been restored to its normal state, and there is no opposition in its movement or harm in any way.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	However, if the bone is prominent in a displaced area of the body, then you should cut it in this way: take a bandage and tie it tightly to the end of that prominent bone, and tell someone to pull it outwards; and place another bandage of thicker wool next to the first bandage; and then bind that over the flesh that is beneath the bone, and extend the ends so as to draw the flesh downwards, and expose the flesh in the area you wish to cut so that the cut doesn't harm the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a piece of wood or a board beneath the bone properly, because when you do that, the cut is not forbidden from not cutting into the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And the cutting should be done on the affected area little by little, because if the corruption is within the cavity of the bone and does not appear upon its surface, you may need to cut it again.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted but not protruding, and one part is still joined to the other, with the corruption located in the middle or part of it, then expose all the flesh around it; then place wood underneath, and cut along the first part where the corruption is until the cut reaches the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And the cut should follow the affected area closely, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut through that corrupted joint and cut the bone where it is connected to the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not a reasonable cause, but a trick of nature.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the flesh of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, you must investigate the corruption in whatever way it appears to you, and expose it, and cleanse it according to every possibility you have, and by any means possible, provided it does not damage a vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the instruments for cutting and sawing these bones are very specific to the bones' location, preparation, thickness, subtle differences, size (large or small), hardness, and density; therefore, you must prepare appropriate instruments for every type of operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And understand that this operation signifies to you the type of instrument you need; when you have great study, long experience, and knowledge of the methods of this art, and experience with illnesses, then you yourself will know what instruments are appropriate for each illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I am now providing you, at the end of this chapter, a list of the instruments you will use, along with instructions on how you will proceed in your treatment, which you will test on other cases.
Forma de serra:	Shape of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Shape of a large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of ray:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this ray be in the shape of a star-shaped key head, and its points be in the shape of the points of a [possibly "alst/alsterfegi" -- a word unclear from this context].
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not suitable unless, with that, the heads of the joints are rubbed when they are corrupted, or the mouth is wide and large.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a larger razor than the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Shape of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Shape of a broad/flat razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	The shape of a well-made saw should be an arched curve,  sharpened on its metal edge, and the wooden part of the saw should be a properly crafted pointed blade.
Forma de lu:	Shape of it (or, the shape of the saw/the object).
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor with a concave curve/hollowed-out part.
Forma de razori autra subtil:	A different, more slender/delicate shape of a razor.
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Shape of another razor with a curved end.
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Shape of a small razor resembling a tentacle.
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Shape of a tool used to cut or make incisions in bones.
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of a smaller incision tool/knife.
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incision tool; this one resembling a ray, and its end is like a saw, and it is used frequently in bone surgery.
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a ray that is suitable for dealing with a bone that is perforated/pierced.
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its tip is triangular and sharply pointed.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly all the tools we have described—razors, incision tools, and saws—should be made of this.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision tips and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities may become diseased either due to internal or external causes, or even if you have treated the corruption with remedies and the treatment is unsuccessful, or if the corruption spreads to a limb not initially affected, then you must make an incision on that limb where the corruption has spread so that the patient escapes death or a greater harm/deficiency in that limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of the afflicted area is that the limb becomes black until it's burned as if by fire, or there might be blackness spreading to the point where it hardens around the limb and spreads to the whole body; and then cut it with an incision there.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the cause of the corruption is the sting of venomous creatures such as a sea scorpion, viper, or similar creatures.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or injury is in the fingertip, then you cut the finger and do not allow the corruption to spread to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if it affects the hand, then you cut it at the base of the forearm, and do not allow the corruption to spread to the arm's forearm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if, instead of that, you find it in the arm, then you cut the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond the elbow, then in that case the patient's death is imminent; and applying any other remedy to this is futile.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, for the foot, if the corruption affects the toe, then you cut it down to one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it spreads to the sole of the foot, then you cut off the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it rises up to the knee, then you cut the leg up to the knee joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the knee, then there is no cure possible, only resignation, and leaving the patient to their fate.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way to cut or sever the limb is that you tighten the ligament in the part just below the place you want to cut, and tighten another ligament above the spot; and the physician stretches a ligament downward, and stretches another ligament upwards; and you separate the flesh that is between the two ligaments with a sharp instrument until all the flesh is exposed; and then it should be cut or severed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to place linen cloths on all sides so that the area is not touched and that the patient receives a properly formed and pus-filled wound.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if you encounter blood flow when working, then cauterize the cut area thoroughly, or place some powders that staunch the blood; and then return to your procedure until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the injured limb with suitable bandages, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I will now relate to you what happened to a man on his foot, the very same accident which I and you have discussed, where he suffered a dark discoloration on his foot, with a burning that resembled a fire's burning.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption first appeared on his toe, until it spread to the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then, the man himself, because he saw the cure for the limb with the force of the pain and burning he endured, cut that foot down to the joint, and the wound healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, that same corruption occurred on the finger of his index hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I was compelled to expel that excess fluid with whatever medicinal remedies I could place on the hand, in an effort to cleanse his body; but the excess wasn't expelled, and it began to spread to the other fingers, until it reached the entire hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he urged me to amputate his hand, but I did not want to do this, hoping for the expulsion of that excess fluid, and fearing the amputation of his hand because of death, for the patient's strength was waning.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he left me, he returned to his homeland, and it came to my knowledge that that man had himself cut off his entire hand, and he healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have related this story only so that it might be helpful in understanding this disease, and that it might serve as a sign, by which it may be recognized and by which it may be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the treatment of sinuses and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy member and the abscess cavity extends until it collects pus, and then it bursts and is perforated, and the pus is discharged, and the area remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin covering it is like a thin cloth, and it has not progressed to further corruption, and it does not affect the bone, nerves, or ligaments, it is called a sinus and not a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the cavity extends until the corruption affects a surrounding part, then it is called a fistula, and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment for it is to cut away that skin completely as it is turned back, especially when it is thin and formed like cloth, and to make certain that it does not adhere to the affected area because of the corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you suspect the skin is adhering and that the corruption hasn't spread further, and there's pus draining from the skin, then treat it with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if you consider it a sinus, and if it is large, and the discharge is foul-smelling, then administer an enema with Egyptian medicine, which is made of oil, vinegar, and honey in equal parts, mixed in a vessel and heated over a fire until the mixture becomes golden brown and resembles honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then, take what is necessary from this mixture, dissolve it with water and honey; and administer this mixture as an enema to the sinus, and compress the opening, and leave the medicine there for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then, remove that (the medicine) with care; and do this for as many days as necessary until the sinus is cleansed and the foul odor has disappeared.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes, if this medicine is not available, it is treated with water mixed with ashes; and for this, you should take the ashes of a plant, mix water with it, then filter the liquid, and administer it as an enema until you are confident the sinus is relieved.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or ash water, then administer an enema of water mixed with honey and finely ground cumin, or administer an enema of wine and honey mixed, for honey has the property of cleansing and washing, while wine helps to adhere to the sinus, especially when the wine contains an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this several times and are sure the sinus is healed, then administer an enema that promotes the growth of flesh in that area.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take diaphenolic unguents and dissolve them in rosemary oil and astringent wine; or you could administer enemas with other medications and ointments that have properties I have already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow and the enema tube cannot be inserted, then widen it gradually with a small iron implement, and apply a poultice wrapped in Egyptian or basil ointment until it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the opening is wide, then you should draw together the edges of the opening with sutures, leaving enough space for the enema tube to pass without difficulty.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening through which the fistula drains is elevated in the upper part, then dry that area at the lowest point to make the fistula drain downwards, because when the fistula is contained within the depth of the sinus, the flesh will grow there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus to the lowest bone as desired, then you must prepare the limb with a preparation so that the fistula drains easily as is appropriate, and so that no cause of blockage of the fistula remains.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines, appropriate for that, and place them on a linen cloth over the sinus.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be large enough to cover the entire sinus; then, using scissors, cut a slightly larger opening into the cloth directly next to the sinus opening; then apply a layer of liniment/ointment to another piece of linen, the size of the cut-out opening, and place this on top, keeping it away from the sinus opening so that the drainage of the fistula is facilitated, and do not remove the larger cloth except after a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is over the sinus opening, should remain at all times, so that what is secreted from the fistula is discharged.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if what flows from the fistula is much or little, or is digested, or is undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And by this, consider the location of the sinus, if the patient feels pain there, and if there is an abscess there.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the matter discharged onto the sinus opening has already adhered, or shows signs of adherence, then on the third day, you detach it, and when you detach the scab, change the cloth to another one and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus there is a thin, subtle discharge, then do not despair of the adherence of it, for the healing process is appropriate; for some people take a long time for flesh to grow over their wounds, and in others, the opposite occurs.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinus a significant amount of undigested discharge has come out for many days, then know that the sinus has not adhered; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and the cause is prolonged, then you should adjust the drying effect of the medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and in their virtue, make them dry like a diafinicon ointment, by adding a dry substance such as zegi.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The final treatment, with which it is cured, is to take diafinicon ointment and dissolve it in rosined oil, and then add old, strong wine to it, and mix it thoroughly, and use that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And similarly in that procedure, when there is no discharge, use diafinicon ointment, honey when it is cooked until it is thickened, and use it; or take myrrh, aloe, and frankincense, grind and powder them, and mix them with honey heated on the fire until thickened, and apply this mixture to a cloth and apply that to the sinus; or apply the thickened honey to a cloth, and apply that to the sinus.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Sometimes it is administered with long, slender roots of a celestial lily (and it is a celestial lily), and the flour of eris and centaury.  Use these simple ingredients, separately or combined, grind them, sift them, and powder them and mix them with the honey previously described; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, then know that the corruption is in the bone, or other hard members or ligaments; then you treat it with fistular treatment, as mentioned above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of whitlow, and of the bruised nail and the incision of the affected finger, and its sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Whitlow is an abscess that arises under the nail of the finger of the hand or foot, and commonly arises on other fingers.  When it is prolonged and its treatment is less favorable, or if it is an abscess from a deep-seated abscess or is corrupted, it emits pus until it corrodes the base of the nail, and frequently corrupts the entire nail.  Often, the corruption spreads to the bone until it has a foul odor, the end of the finger is blackened, and the color is dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Therefore, when you have done what we have said in the division, and your treatment does not work, then you should cut away all the excess of the nail with iron, and then cauterize the wound with that, for cautery is very helpful in this.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	However, if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the nail's additions have already pushed the flesh inward, and they begin to pierce and ulcerate it, then you should place a thin blade under the angle of the nail that is piercing the flesh, and lift it up and cut the flesh easily, and place on what remains of the flesh the burning and corrosive remedies until it is completely removed; and then treat that with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then you must cut into the bone and remove it, for a corrupted bone will never heal.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption extend to the finger, then you cut it at one of the joints, according to the prognosis of its recovery, and then treat it until it is healed.
